cinnamon.engine.utils

Class BinaryBVH<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.utils.BinaryBVH<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LockingSpacePartitioningTree<E>, SpacePartitioningTree<E>

    public final class BinaryBVH<E>
extends Object
implements LockingSpacePartitioningTree<E>

    Self-balancing binary tree implementation of a LockingSpacePartitioningTree using bounding boxes for partitioning. This implementation follows the scheme of a bounding volume hierarchy where volumes that are not at the leaves are merely container volumes for those below. As the significant portion of the BinaryBVH does not hold workable elements, this has the effect of increased memory.

    Padding

    Each containing volume can be expanded more than is necessary to encompass its children volumes through the padding passed during construction. A larger than necessary containing volume could allow volumes below it in the hierarchy to move without requiring a call to update(Bounds) on the moved element, avoiding the need to balance the tree.

    Performance

    add(Bounds, E), remove(Bounds), and update(Bounds) take O(log n) in the worst-case with the generalized mass update() method taking O(n log n). The ancillary methods size(), isEmpty(), and contains(Bounds) are constant.

    It is slightly more efficient to synchronize all elements at once through update() instead of looping through all elements and calling update(Bounds) unless only a handful of Bounds-element pairs have been moved or resized, in which case the latter is sufficient.

      • BinaryBVH

        public BinaryBVH(float padding,
                 int initialCapacity,
                 float growth)

        Constructs a BinaryBVH with a specific volume padding, initial capacity, and growth.

        Parameters:
        padding - for containing boxes.
        initialCapacity - initial capacity for key-value pairs.
        growth - normalized factor for capacity expansion.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if padding <= 0 or padding is > 1, initialCapacity is <= 0, or growth is <= 0 or growth > 1.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(Bounds bounds,
                   E element)

        Adds a Bounds-element pair.

        Successfully adding a Bounds to the tree will cause bounds.isExclusivelyPartitioned() to return true and prevent the Bounds from being added to another LockingSpacePartitioningTree.

        Specified by:
        add in interface LockingSpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Specified by:
        add in interface SpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Parameters:
        bounds - element's simplified volume.
        element - to partition.
        Returns:
        true if the pair was successfully added, false if already in the partition.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bounds or element is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the bounds is already inside a LockingSpacePartitioningTree.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Description copied from interface: LockingSpacePartitioningTree

        Removes all Bounds elements.

        All Bounds are released and calling bounds.isExclusivelyPartitioned() on any of the removed Bounds will return false. After this method executes, these Bounds are free to be added to other LockingSpacePartitioningTrees.

        Specified by:
        clear in interface LockingSpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Specified by:
        clear in interface SpacePartitioningTree<E>

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Description copied from interface: SpacePartitioningTree

        Returns true if either the given object is the same tree instance or the following conditions are met.

        • The given object is also a SpacePartitioningTree and both trees have the same size.
        • Each Bounds-element pair has a corresponding pair in the other tree whose Bounds and element are equivalent in the following expression bounds.equals(otherBounds) && element.equals(otherElement).
        Specified by:
        equals in interface SpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - to test for equality.
        Returns:
        true if equal to this tree.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Description copied from interface: SpacePartitioningTree

        The hash code is computed as if by the following.

             
         for (pair : content) {
             int pairHash = initial * 31 + pair.bounds.hashCode();
             pairHash = 31 * pairHash + pair.element.hashCode();

             treeHash = 31 * treeHash + pairHash;
         }
        Specified by:
        hashCode in interface SpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        hash code for the tree.

      • remove

        public E remove(Bounds bounds)

        Removes a Bounds and its element.

        Successfully removing a Bounds from the tree will release this tree's lock and cause bounds.isExclusivelyPartitioned() to return false. After this method executes, the Bounds can be added to another LockingSpacePartitioningTree.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface LockingSpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Specified by:
        remove in interface SpacePartitioningTree<E>
        Parameters:
        bounds - element's simplified volume.
        Returns:
        element associated with bounds, or null if nothing was removed.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bounds is null.
